abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
An object that stores image data in a form that can be readily transferred to the screen.
A user interface element that contains and displays text, scroll, and browser views, in addition to other view subclasses.
An
object is a vertical matrix of
objects to implement the fields.
The
class is used to implement text entry fields in a form. The left part of an
object contains a title. The right part contains an editable text entry field.
An object that handles the measurement and display of a single menu item in its encompassing frame.
An object that represents an OpenGL graphics context, into which all OpenGL calls are rendered.
A subclass of
that is suitable for rendering OpenGL into layers.
Invoked to ask the layer whether it can (or should) draw.
Draws the OpenGL content for the specified time.
The layer’s OpenGL context.
Returns the OpenGL context to use for the requested pixel format.
Provides access to the layer’s associated OpenGL pixel format.
Returns the OpenGL pixel format suitable for the specified displays.
Returns the view associated with the layer.
An object that provides access to accelerated offscreen rendering.
An object that specifies the types of buffers and other attributes of the OpenGL context.
A view that displays OpenGL content in a view.
Render advanced 3D graphics and compute data in parallel with graphics processors.
Build Metal apps quicker and easier using a common set of utility classes.
A layer that provides a layer suitable for rendering OpenGL content.
A layer that provides a layer suitable for rendering OpenGL content.
Methods that model a hierarchical timing system, allowing objects to map time between their parent and local time.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
